page.title: 13YONSEA
page.content:
The A20 Trunk road runs across the S.W. corner of the square.
The Ashford to London railway line cuts across the N.E. corner of the square, this does isolate the square with regard to movement on foot.
The ground rises gradually towards the North. The whole square being open ground. There are only two farms in the square,{Beachbrook Farm}and{Yonsea {Farm,}they are relatively large farms for the area.
A Flour mill which lies in the S.E. corner is still in use and has recently been modernised.
The{M20 Motor-way}will cut through the N.E. corner of the square East of the railway line.
